title: Workshop on Strengthening Learning Ownership Through Generative AI

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and experience in secondary education administration
context.additional_context: Exploring Strategies to Enhance Learning Autonomy Using AI Tools Based on Administrator Experience in Educational Program Design and Operation

learning_goals: Participants can diagnose three or more aspects of learning ownership—self-efficacy, responsibility, belonging, and identity—when utilizing generative AI (ChatGPT)
Participants can develop and implement two or more practical applications of generative AI within and outside the learning process
Participants can explain five or more commonalities and differences in AI-based learning ownership across diverse learning environments (asynchronous/synchronous, neurodiverse conditions)
Participants can analyze three-dimensional ways in which generative AI contributes to educational equity

resources: Analog Journal for Learning Activity Documentation
Offline Small-Group Collaborative Learning Kit for Case Studies
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
